text:
Bit frustrated with the Drag-n-Drop email builder...
1. Sending test emails and Images are not loading in gmail, just shows the Alt text (they're `png` types) and have tried with multiple different images. I have a support ticket #2314159 that's been open for 4 days but supposedly will get some information by tomorrow (hopefully). I should note that Gmail settings is enabled to display external images.
2. To try and fix a blurry rendering issue, was going to try inlining an image in a Rich Text module, with its src appending `?noresize` cause the serverside image minification gave a really blurry result. However, i found that I can't add an image through a Rich Text Module. No *insert image* button, nor can I inline it through the source code (the `<img>` tag gets stripped out). I'm assuming it's intended to use the *Image* module instead. Just curious as to why if there's another reason.

I know the tool is still in beta, but we already have a client that's gone from very excited to disappointed, and haven't been able to give much more insight than "HubSpot is looking into it."

The only solution i've come across so far for my issue #1 above is to use an *HTML* block instead and place the `<img>` tag inside that.
However, this method isn't very friendly for an end user that might not know HTML too well
`<img>` tag in an *HTML* block will not render in a test email if it has the `width` attribute inlined on the tag...

will there be a way for devs to add media queries to a drag’n drop email? For example, text set at 60px looks fine on desktop, but mobile it blows up the screen.

I’ve seen other email providers that wrap text in a class like `p60` and then use media queries to target that class on mobile.
